items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
Lift your right knee up towards your chest while simultaneously lowering your hips into a squat position.
Make sure your knee is in line with your toes and your weight is evenly distributed between both feet.
Hold the squat position for a few seconds before standing back up and lowering your right leg back down to the ground.
Repeat the exercise with your left leg.
Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Strengthens the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes
Improves cardiovascular endurance
Increases hip mobility and flexibility
Engages the core muscles for stability and balance
Can be modified for different fitness levels and goals
